Colouration upon Chubby Mountain! I am Aya Maruyama!
The main vocalist of Pastel*Palettes, enjoys browsing social networking sites and studying selfies. Likes Western food like omelette rice and hamburger steak, dislikes octopus.

Aya has dreamed of becoming an idol since childhood, inspired by Ayumi, the main vocalist of the idol group Marmalade. After three years of training, Aya was finally selected as the main vocalist of Pastel*Palettes.

Lacks self-confidence, gets nervous and stage-frightened easily, and often trips over her tongue, making her not very good at improvisation. Has fragile tear glands and cries easily when emotions well up. However, offstage, Aya is always cheerful, lively, and full of energy, helpful, and loves being an idol.

In fact, Aya Maruyama is sensitive inside, tormented by a desire for recognition. So she rarely disguises herself in public (hoping to be recognized) and often secretly searches her own name online—if connected to our world, Aya might be greeted by a vast ocean of various "anti-Aya memes".
(Compiled from Fandom and Moegirlpedia)

The term "Garage" can refer to either a parking garage or an auto repair shop. Where there is car manufacturing, there will inevitably be car repair; the auto repair industry has been an indispensable part of the automotive industry since its birth. Many famous brands started with repair services (though they might have repaired bicycles or motorcycles initially) and grew from there.

And "car repair" (修车, Xiūchē) is one of the most important components of the "anti-Aya memes" (see Leader Civilopedia entry for Aya Maruyama). This parody originates from Pastel*Palettes' representative song "Shuwarin☆Dreamin'" — its first lyric "しゅわしゅわ" (shuwa shuwa) sounds similar to "修哇修哇" (Xiū wa xiū wa, Repair, repair), leading to the joke that Aya Maruyama is a "car repair master." Interestingly, in the Bilibili Collection launched by the simplified Chinese version of "BanG Dream! Girls Band Party!", there is an emote of Aya Maruyama holding two wrenches, captioned "修哇修哇" (Xiū wa xiū wa).
